thesis.description: About 25,000 acres of flax for fiber was grown during the second world war in the Province of Québec when the traditional sources of supply in Europe were cut off (Anonymous). With the armistice, the prices dropped and farmers abandoned this crop because of competition from European countries. In the 1950's a few farmers became interested in growing flax for linseed oil, chiefly in the Montreal area. The acreage bas increased steadily, so that by 1964 flax was being grown on about 35,000 acres in this Province (Shiller 1964). [...]

thesis.description: Studies were made of the effects of Vitamin A supplementation on the course of artificially induced lungworm infection in calves. Vitamin A deficient, Jersey bull calves, were infected with 2,000 D. viviparus larvae and supplemented with either 2 ug/lb/day or 60 ug/lb/day of Vitamin A. [...]

thesis.subject: Lungworms.
Animal Science.
Calves -- Diseases.
thesis.title: Studies on the interrelationship between vitamin A intake and Dictyocaulus Viviparus infection in calves.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The introduction of Ge (Li) detectors for gamma rays allows a much better resolution than that obtainable previously with the scintillator-photomultiplier unit. Indeed the average loss of energy per ion pair in a Ge (Li) detector is about 2.4 eV, compared to the 130 eV required for one photoelectron in a scintillator-photomultiplier unit. [...]

thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Ge (Li) study of gamma rays from light xenon isotopes.
